title: Signs of recovery at Vodafone as decline slows in Europe
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Fri, Jul 24, 2015, 10:46 BST - UK Markets close in 5 hrs 44 mins Signs of recovery at Vodafone as decline slows in Europe By Sophie Jamieson | Telegraph – 13 minutes ago -0.095 
A strong performance in emerging markets helped boost Vodafone's first quarter results 
Vodafone, the international mobile phone company, has begun to recover in Europe after years of decline, with overall revenue boosted by strong performance in emerging markets and beating analyst expectations. 
The FTSE 100 company reported a drop in revenue of 0.9pc to £10.1bn for the first quarter to June 30. But organic sales, an important sector indicator, were up 3.3pc, the second quarter in a row of growth for Vodafone following ten consecutive quarters of decline. 
Figures were helped by a 6.1pc rise in organic service revenue in the Africa, Middle East and Asia Pacific regions. 
In Europe organic revenue declined 1.5pc, but Vodafone said performance was continuing to recover and the company was managing to retain more of its customers. 
Vodafone now has 24.1 million 4G customers in 18 markets, the company said in a statement. 
Vittorio Colao, chief executive of Vodafone 
The UK bucked the European trend, with service revenue up 0.2pc, boosted by a 0.7pc increase in mobile service revenue. But fixed service revenue was down 1.3pc. 
Vodafone now has 12.3m fixed broadband customers in the UK. 
Vittorio Colao, the telecom company's chief executive, said it has been “a good start to the year”. 
He added: “Our emerging markets have maintained their strong momentum and more of our European businesses are returning to growth, as customer demand for 4G and data takes off." 
Shares (Frankfurt: DI6.F - news ) in Vodafone were up 2.4pc this morning following the trading update.
